SDK Release Information

3DxWare Driver Installation

Before you install the 3DxWare SDK for Windows, you must have the 3DxWinWare driver version 17.5.x or newer installed on your computer. The driver is included in the 3DxWare 10 installation package.

New in this Release

This release of the 3DxWare SDK (v. 3.4.0) contains the following changes:

  • New: Hints allow an application to tell the 3DxWare driver about specific characteristics of the application. For example, it may tell the driver that it is expecting specific types of button events, or that it is using a specific API.
  • Change: Converted the 3DxTest32 sample to only use V3DCMD actions (see the Device Buttons sections).
  • Change: Simplify the user-interface of the Action Interface sample.
  • Change: Changed the installation default location to be in the user's program files (%LOCALAPPDATA%\Programs).
  • Change: Changed the "Online Doc" and "ReadMe" shortcuts in Start menu to "3DxWare SDK Documentation" and "3DxWare SDK ReadMe".
  • Fix: Correct and expanded the Action Interface icon types and structures descriptions in the Action Interface Types and Structures section.
  • Fix: Fixed a compilation error of the Action Interface sample when built in Visual Studio 2017.

Additional change details from the SDK version 3.3.1 (r13492) notes:

  • Improve robustness of the TestSiapp Sample demo program to handle the exception thrown if the 3Dconnexion 3DxWare driver is not installed and memory misalignment error when compiled using older versions of Visual Studio.

Additional change details from the SDK version 3.3.0 (r13306) notes:

  • Add a "best practice" section for the Quick Views concept. The concept introduces the new V3DCMD commands V3DCMD_SAVE_VIEW_x and V3DCMD_VIEW_x and the function SiMessageBox.
  • Added information on an update to the Action Interface to add support for action "description" (command tooltips) and "icons" (command images). The update changes some of the Action Interface structures, adds new types and structures and the new function SiAppCmdWriteActionImages. The Action Interface demo was updated to reflect the changes.
  • Added the TestSiapp Sample demo program to demonstrate how to integrate the SDK on a C# WinForms program.
  • Update header files.
  • Changed minimum driver version to 17.4 (only required if using the update to the Action Interface strucutres and functions).
  • Change supported operation system versions to Vista and newer as per 3DxWinCore v. 17.4 requirements.
  • Upgrade 3DxTest and 3DxTstMFC demo projects to Visual Studio 2015.
  • Corrected documentation of functions SiOpen and SiSetUiMode.

Additional change details from the SDK version 3.2.0 (r11461) notes:

  • Add a "best practice" section for the QuickZoom concept.
  • Added a section on the Action Interface extension that further improves 3Dconnexion product abstraction (future-proofing) and related new structures and functions (SiAppCmdActivateActionSet and SiAppCmdWriteActionSet).
  • Added the Action Interface demo program.
  • Update header files.
  • Changed minimum driver version to 17.2 (only required if using the Action Interface strucutres and functions).
  • Formatting and error corrections in this SDK documentation.

Additional change details from the SDK version 3.1.0 notes:

  • Remove dependency on the CRT in the 3DxWare Input Library, siapp.lib. Library available as a single file per platform.
  • Formatting and error corrections in this SDK documentation.
  • Minor clean-up to header files to remove unnecessary includes and enums.

Additional change details from the SDK version 3.0.2 notes:

  • Simplify API structure. Deprecate SI Cfg saving functions and SI Sync extension.
  • SDK license no longer allows redistribution of DLL binary files (these are always included in the driver user installation).
  • Only USB devices are supported.
  • The static libraries were all moved into the same directory under lib (x86/x64).
  • Added prebuilt versions of the static libraries for four CRT usages: Multi-threaded DLL (default), Multi-threaded Debug DLL (D suffix), Multi-threaded (static) (MT suffix), Multi-threaded Debug (static) (MTD suffix).
  • Some of the include files have been cleaned up and split.  This should not affect existing code.
  • In conjunction with 3DxWare 10, your application can now support multiple simultaneously connected devices and run-time Plug-n-Play (PnP) of those devices.
  • Your application can interrogate the number and type of connected devices. You can address each device separately or all as a group.
  • A 3Dx device no longer has to be connected when your application starts. The end-user can connect, disconnect and change devices at any time.
  • A new event is sent to your application when a device leaves or arrives.

Notes of changes for older releases:

  • 64-bit Itanium is no longer supported.
  • Somewhat unrelated to the SDKs, SiSetUIMode was enabled again in 3DxWare 5.0.  It had been disabled in 3DxWare releases for several years.  Applications may now notice that the 3DxWare GUI will be displayed when their application starts if they used the sample code.  Applications should change SI_UI_ALL_CONTROLS to SI_UI_NO_CONTROLS to change this behavior.
  • Only 32-bit release versions of the library compiled with the Microsoft Visual 2008 compiler are provided.
  • Microsoft Visual Studio 2008 solutions are provided for rebuilding libraries and demos.
  • The 3DxWarThe 3DxWare Input library, siapp, is packaged as a separate library.  It must be specifically included in the link and siapp.h must be specifically included in the source files.
  • The math library is now named spwmath.li>
  • The tuning for the device has changed internal to the library. Any applications using a previous version of the SDK may need to change the tuning constants to maintain the correct feel.
  • SiDispatch is provided for backward compatibility only. It is not recommended that you use this function.
  • SiSetTypeMask is obsolete, but a stubbed version is provided for backwards compatibility.

Included Files

When referencing 3DxWare SDK directories and files, this document uses the string directory where you installed the SDK. The default directory (<SDK>) is:

C:\Program Files\3Dconnexion\3DxWare SDK\

3DxWare DLLs

Executables from the SDK require a Dynamic Link Library (DLL), siappdll.dll.  This is installed in your Windows "system32" directory as part of the standard 3DxWare software installation. This file must be in the Windows system directory in order for the 3Dconnexion device to work properly.

3DxWare Libraries

There are two 3DxWare libraries: the Input Library and the Math Library. The libraries are available in binary form and were generated using the Microsoft Visual C++ compiler, version 9.0.

The versions of the libraries that are prebuilt are for multi-threaded release applications.

Math Library

 

<SDK>\lib\<platform>\spwmath.lib

static Math Library compiled for release multi-threaded applications using the CRT DLL

<SDK>\lib\<platform>\spwmathD.lib

static Math Library compiled for release multi-threaded applications using the Debug CRT DLL

<SDK>\lib\<platform>\spwmathMT.lib

static Math Library compiled for release multi-threaded applications using the CRT statically linked

<SDK>\lib\<platform>\spwmathMTD.lib

static Math Library compiled for release multi-threaded applications using the debug CRT statically linked

 

Input Library

 

<SDK>\lib\<platform>\siapp.lib

static Input Library compiled for multi-threaded release or debug applications. The library has no CRT dependency.

3DxWare Include Files

Include Files  
<SDK>\inc\si.h Input Library header file
<SDK>\inc\siappcmd.h Function declarations used in the Action Interface extension.
<SDK>\inc\siappcmd_types.h Variable types used in the Action Interface extension.
<SDK>\inc\siDefines.h Input Library just defines and enums
<SDK>\inc\siapp.h Siapp library function definitions
<SDK>\inc\spwdata.h 3DxWare data definitions
<SDK>\inc\spwerror.h 3DxWare error codes
<SDK>\inc\spwmacro.h 3DxWare macros
<SDK>\inc\spwmath.h Math Library header file
<SDK>\inc\SiSync.h GUI Synchronization constants and data types
<SDK>\inc\SiSyncDefines.h GUI Synchronization defines and enums
<SDK>\inc\SiSyncPriv.h Included by SiSync.h. (This file must not be included explicitly.)
<SDK>\inc\SiCfg.h Registry configuration saving and retrieving function declarations (Deprecated in SDK v. 3.0)
<SDK>\inc\V3DCMD.h Enums for all current Virtual 3D Commands (V3DCMD)
<SDK>\inc\V3DKey.h Enums for all current Virtual 3D Keys (V3DK)
<SDK>\inc\virtualkeys.h Helper enums and functions to support 3D mouse generically (disregarding device type)
<SDK>\inc\3DxWareVersionNumbers.h 3DxWare version information (Used by some demos. File should not be ignored by third-party programs.)
